title: Document recommended repo setup
body:
Forked from https://github.com/kubernetes/kops/issues/644

I think it would be useful to describe the recommended setup for repos in the template.

For example, admin and maintainers (write) teams.

And how to turn on the bot. And copy labels.

And OWNERS.

Etc

cc @grodrigues3

title: Please update the LICENSE with the copyright holder
body:
It should be "The Kubernetes Authors".

Most repos haven't modified the boilerplate `Copyright {yyyy} {name of copyright owner}`

title: Update CONTRIBUTING.md with CNCF CLAs
body: I assume we need CNCF CLAs now that we are part of CNCF. Please double-check the links and the text. I am not sure what is the official/legal way to represent this.

title: Fix typo
body: Fix typo in Events Code of Conduct

title: Update README.md with links for Slack and SIG
body:
Slack - pointing to (http://slack.k8s.io/)
Mailing List - retagged
SIG - pointing to (https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/sig-list.md)

title: Set correct project start date
body:
Previously the README stated the project started 2006-01-02. I wasn't so interested in the Kubernetes project back then, but I'm pretty sure it didn't exist at the time ðŸ˜‰ 

Hopefully it's okay to make PRs directly against this repo.

title: Rename OWNERS assignees: to approvers:
body:
They are effectively the same, assignees is deprecated

ref: kubernetes/test-infra#3851

title: add steering committee to OWNERS
body: cc @spiffxp

title: Add steering-committe as approvers for this repo
body:
To ensure that the entire kubernetes/steering-committee team doesn't need admin access to this repo, add them as approvers

Fixes #9

title: Fix typo
body: Followon to #10, I can't spell

title: Change code-of-conduct to call by reference
body: This matches what kubernetes/kubernetes has.

title: Use kubernetes/community as source of truth for code of conduct
body: One more layer of indirection, I would prefer all of our repos refer to Kubernetes' CoC, which at the moment is a redirect to CNCF's.

title: Remove incubator content, touchup existing requirements
body:
Trying to bring this repo in alignment with the way things are today:
- we keep talking about how incubator is / should going away, so... drop wording about it?
- very few repos in kubernetes/ have RELEASE.md files
- almost every repo now uses the exact code-of-conduct.md from this repo
- [docs repos don't use the apache 2 license](https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/governance.md#repository-guidelines)
- OWNERS files point to owners docs
- remove reference to godep from CONTRIBUTING.md (not all repos are golang, not all golang repos have chosen to use that)
- link to to canonical CLA instructions at https://git.k8s.io/community/CLA.md

This is in the interest of making this repo a living example of a "correct" repo, per https://github.com/kubernetes/community/pull/1569

title: OWNERS: Upstream docs moved from devel/ to guide/
body: Catch up with kubernetes/community#1764.

title: Document DCO signed-off-by requirement?
body:
The [CNCF charter][1] has (Â§11.c):

> All new inbound code contributions to the CNCF shall be (i) accompanied by a Developer Certificate of Origin sign-off (http://developercertificate.org) and (ii) made under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (available at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0), such license to be in addition to, and shall not supersede, obligations undertaken under the contribution license agreement(s) provided for in (b) above.

But the `CONTRIBUTING.md` file in this repository currently only mentions the CLA ~~(which is optional per-project, as discussed in Â§11.b)~~.  It should probably be expanded to include the DCO and Signed-off-by docs (I have [a project for including stock docs][2], or you can write your own) to comply with Â§11.c, ~~and may deserve a note (in the docs requested in #2?) to point out that project owners can remove the CLA requirement if they want~~ [EDIT: CLAs are [not optional][3] for Kubernetes projects].

[1]: https://www.cncf.io/about/charter/
[2]: https://github.com/wking/signed-off-by
[3]: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes-template-project/issues/16#issuecomment-377096061
